column4: Yeah i figured. I got so tired of doing that before. Every darn time.
that can be an issue with moving linux filesystems about. :) user id's can change and goof up ownership.
set the  modes to 777 on the stuff..  then anyone can access them all..  but thats not a good fix.. your groups method may be a better way.
ive learned to set the uid's on all my users on the various linux box's i use identically. so  my file ownership/s dont change when i move my flash drives from one to another.
Ok cool. BTW what are the numbers I keep seeing mean for permissions? that 777 666 etc. Are they group or user numbers?
those are file permisions.. neither one. :) chown for owner.. chmod for modes.
theres guides  and docs and examples of what all those mean.
really somthing worth reading up on. I rarely use the groups feature.
Right on brotha! Thank you that gives me somethimg new to google and learn. Later!
i saw a little google desktop gadget that lets you click on a thing and it shows the ### permisions :)
ive seen some  netbook tweak threads on the forums that mention similer things i recall
ive not seen a way to do that.. (yet) but  the wife took my netbook soi havent checked into   it in the last month.
you may want to test out moovida (i think i spelt it right) its sort of like that
Cool thanks Ill check that out.
Miro can also do that. but im not sure its in the repos.
